member.param: The forum data provider where the statistics should be done.
if set recalculates the statistics just for the forums in a specific group
if set recalculates the statistics just for this forum
member.remarks: This method is not protected for locking exceptions caused by parallel update of the statistics from other threads/processes It should be run after large import of data into the forums.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Forums.ForumsManager.UnsubscribeUser(Telerik.Sitefinity.Security.Model.User,Telerik.Sitefinity.Forums.SubscriptionType,System.Guid,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Un-subscribes the user for forum notifications .
member.param: Type of the subscription to unsubscribe from (forum or thread).
Name of the forums data provider where the forum/thread is stored. This is null by default and takes the default data provider.
The event origin. When user is (un)subscribed, an event is rised. The event origin can be used to determine where this event comes from. This is null by default.

member.name: M:Telerik.Sitefinity.Forums.ForumsManager.SubscribeUser(Telerik.Sitefinity.Security.Model.User,Telerik.Sitefinity.Forums.SubscriptionType,System.Guid,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Subscribes the user for forum notifications.
member.param: The user to subscribe. The email and names are taken from the user to be used in the subscription notifications

Type of the subscription.If 'forum' the user receives notifications for new threads in the specified forum(itemId). If 'thread' the user receives notifications for new posts in the specified thread(itemId)
The forum or thread id depending on the subscriptionType.
Name of the forums data provider where the forum/thread is stored. This is null by default and takes the default data provider.
The event origin. When user is (un)subscribed, an event is rised. The event origin can be used to determine where this event comes from. This is null by default.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.Forums.Model.ForumThread.OriginalForum
member.summary: Gets the original forum. This property is automatically set when we try to change the thread forum to the previous value of the Forum property(move thread to another forum) This property is used to enforce Move thread permissions in the forums provider. Only when the current forum is different from the original we apply those permissions
member.remarks: This property is used by the forums security validation system. It is not persisted,

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.Forums.Model.ForumThread.DemandManagePermissions
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether before persisting a change in the Forum thread we should demand the Manage thread permissions is granted for the modifying user This property is automatically set when a user tries to modify any of the following properties: IsLocked, IsMarkedSpam, ThreadType (stick on top etc.) Changing any of these properties requires Manage Thread permission, which is different from the Modify thread permission(concerns only the thread title)
member.remarks: This property is used by the forums security validation system.It is not persisted,

member.summary: Gets the previous(original) value of the IsPublished property. This is used when deciding to recalculate the forums statistics. Published/Unpublished threads cause a recalculation.

member.name: P:Telerik.Sitefinity.Forums.Model.Forum.Ordinal
member.summary: Gets or sets the position of the forum inside a Forum Group. This is used when visualizing logically grouped forums and we need them to be sorted in a specific order inside their group. The property allows to reorder the forums by some logical priority. This setting applies only at the group level. Check also how to set the forum Group The type of the ordinal is float since this allow for easily inserting an item between two other items by choosing a value in between them, without renumbering the whole collection

member.summary: Gets or sets the group the forum belongs to. Forums can be logically grouped (for example "Support forums", "General forums" etc.). Also the group represents a security root. All forums from a specific group inherit the same group permissions settings unless they break the permissions inheritance from the forum group. Forum groups themselves inherit permissions settings from the top Forum Module security root, so if a forum group hasn't broken permissions inheritance from the module level- the forum will inherit directly the Module level permissions

member.name: T:Telerik.Sitefinity.Forums.Publishing.ForumsInboundPipe
member.summary: This is the inbound pipe used for forums in the publishing system. It is able to process forum posts and threads.
member.remarks: A specific approach is taken to make a search in the forums return both threads and posts: When a thread is added to search index, only its title is indexed. When a post is added to the search index, its title is taken from the thread title (as posts have not titles), but only the content is indexed.
